item.title: 10 Games That Are Officially Harder Than Elden Ring
item.description:
We’ve become used to Dark Souls (and Soulsborne titles more broadly) being used as a synonym for difficulty. True enough, these games sport some of the meanest bosses in the business (including an outrageous number of furious dragons), and if players aren't deft with their parries and blocks, they might quickly grow frustrated with repeated deaths. This isn’t to say that the likes of Elden Ring have a monopoly on difficulty.

From classic, infamous platformers to the latest super-challenging titles, this selection of titles is officially harder than Elden Ring . Of course, opinions on the hardest games will differ wildly, so to remove some of the subjectivity from proceedings, we’ll only be including titles that have a higher average difficulty rating than Elden Ring on How Difficult Is It and in GameFAQs’ user ratings ( Elden Ring scores 7.2 out of 10 in the former and 4.09 out of 5 in the latter).

Celeste

How Difficult Is It: 7.6/10, GameFAQs Difficulty Rating: 4.1/5

Celeste
Released
January 25, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Alcohol Reference, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language
Developer(s)
Extremely OK Games
Genre(s)
Platformer
Powered by

This 2018 indie platformer is full of heart, tackling critical themes of loneliness, motivation, and the human spirit through the simple lens of a girl climbing a mountain. It does a great job of giving the platforming and the story that underpins it equal weight, but the most notable aspect of Celeste for many players is how fiendishly challenging it can be. It’s a game that gives players all the tools they need to succeed (jumping, climbing, wall-bouncing, etc.) and then sends them off to experiment with those tools until they do.

The 2D art is charming and detailed, and the environments are perfectly designed to test the player's mastery of everything Madeline can do. Near-instant respawns mean it’s highly encouraged to persevere, even when bottomless caverns, spike pits, and all manner of traps will catch them out at every turn. Each chapter introduces its own gimmick that affects these things, and the greatest players will practice and practice until they can even dominate the B-sides (the harder versions of each level) and beyond.

Bloodborne

How Difficult Is It: 8.2/10, GameFAQs Difficulty Rating: 4.13/5

Bloodborne
Released
March 24, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Violence
Developer(s)
From Software
Genre(s)
Action, RPG, Soulslike
Powered by

In 2015, Bloodborne took FromSoft’s familiar combat formula in a very different direction. Those who were used to heavy armor and equally heavy use of a shield quickly learned that Hunters don’t fight like that. A much more aggressive and reactive approach was required, focused on dodging attacks, countering with swift strikes, and firing off well-timed pistol shot parries to allow for Visceral Attacks where possible.

Opinions will vary a lot as to which Soulsborne game is the most difficult, but there’s no denying that some of Bloodborne’s DLC bosses, in particular, are absolutely brutal. The likes of Ludwig the Accursed and the Orphan of Kos await, and they’re not to be taken lightly. Against regular foes, it’s easy to be mobbed in areas such as the Forbidden Woods, and players are usually only a few hits from returning to a checkpoint.

Darkest Dungeon

How Difficult Is It: 8.3/10, GameFAQs Difficulty Rating: 4.6/5

Darkest Dungeon
9 /10
Released
January 19, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Alcohol Reference, Blood and Gore, Mild Language, Partial Nudity, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Red Hook Studios
Genre(s)
RPG
Powered by

Like Bloodborne , Darkest Dungeon was also released in 2015. In another parallel, both games blend a dark, gloomy aesthetic and themes with a brutal level of difficulty. Red Hook Studios' turn-based RPG sees the player managing a roster of adventurers and warriors who have come to their inherited hamlet in pursuit of their fortunes. The gameplay loop revolves around forming teams from this roster of different hero classes and sending them on quests into different areas of the estate’s surrounding region.

Party members will accrue Stress damage as well as HP damage, they acquire negative personality Quirks as well as positive ones, and RNG sometimes seems downright antagonistic. Running out of certain kinds of supplies can be fatal, and a single critical hit can start a chain of events that is very difficult to recover from. The number of turns a boss can take to kill, and the damage they can deal, is extraordinary. Darkest Dungeon warns players right from the start that there will be times when they have no choice but to let a hero die or to retreat from a quest, and it's not kidding. There are so many factors to consider, from how well-lit the party's torch is to a potential illness a party member might have contracted, that it all seems hopeless. That's the point, and it's also why success feels so rewarding

Cuphead

How Difficult Is It: 8.6/10, GameFAQs Difficulty Rating: 4.26/5

Cuphead
9 /10
Released
September 29, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco
Developer(s)
Studio MDHR Entertainment Inc.
Genre(s)
Platformer
Powered by

Cuphead is, first and foremost, a boss rush affair. It’s become beloved and infamous in equal measure for the inventiveness, sublime animation, and sheer difficulty of those bosses. As befits its retro styling, Cuphead is an old-school experience that will often see players practicing, observing boss movesets and patterns, and gradually learning the flow of each fight. As with other titles on this list, it teaches players the fundamentals with early encounters such as Goopy la Grande and Cagney Carnation, before steadily making those patterns more elaborate and harder to predict as the storyline progresses.

Endgame battles, such as against King Dice, have all kinds of different phases, and there’s so much happening on the screen that it's hard to process all at once. The Delicious Last Course expansion takes this a step further, introducing elements that confound even veterans before they get used to it. The run and gun levels aren’t an emphasis of the action, but they’re deviously designed, placing obstacles, enemies, and a constant barrage of projectiles in just the right spots to maximize the carnage.

Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice

How Difficult Is It: 8.7/10, GameFAQs Difficulty Rating: 4.49/5

Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice
Released
March 22, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Violence
Developer(s)
From Software
Genre(s)
Action RPG
Powered by

When it comes to Soulsborne games, every fan will have their own idea of the hardest games and bosses therein. As far as How Difficult Is It is concerned, though, Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice is the hardest of the games overall, ranking in eighth place on the site’s Top 100. Bloodborne is next, in 17th position, and it’s quite clear what the two have in common: mobility and agility are key in both titles, prioritized over defense, and timing is critical to their combat systems. In Sekiro , the protagonist has a wide range of mobility tools at his disposal, and he will be quickly dispatched with a simple miscalculation or two.

Not only is combat very fast, even in standard encounters, but it’s complex too. The posture system is absolutely central to battles, and while panicked dodging may prevent some damage, it can set Wolf back offensively, meaning that every single movement players make needs to be calculated. If they don’t get a firm grasp on this system, players will find nothing but frustration in Sekiro , and the ever-evolving enemy movesets and tactics (with some formidable bosses) ensure it remains just as difficult throughout. There’s a lot of freedom of movement in the game compared to the rather more static Soulsborne games, but this one comes with a lot of additional challenges.

Super Meat Boy

How Difficult Is It: 8.9/10, GameFAQs Difficulty Rating: 4.55/5

Super Meat Boy
9 /10
Released
October 20, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Animated Blood, Cartoon Violence, Crude Humor, Language
Developer(s)
Team Meat
Genre(s)
Platformer
Powered by

Much like Celeste , Super Meat Boy is a classic platformer designed to test every iota of the player’s skill with its mechanics. A gritty and very gory experience, the influence of Edmund McMillen (of The Binding of Isaac fame) is clear throughout. There are so many spikes, whirring blades, and other deadly hazards in the game’s many stages that it’s intimidating to even look at. It’s a trial-and-error game of steady improvement, one which follows another similar principle to Celeste : it’s not about puzzles as such, and it's easy to see where to go, but having the timing and reaction speed to string together moves to get there is the issue.

There’s a wealth of nicely varied content for those with the patience to stick with it. The freedom to select levels from each chapter means that there’s some relief if players really can’t complete a challenge for the time being. The sense of relief and elation when they finally do, however, is right up there with an Elden Ring boss.

God Hand

How Difficult Is It: 9.1/10, GameFAQs Difficulty Rating: 4.12/5

God Hand
Released
October 10, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m // Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Clover Studio
Genre(s)
Beat 'Em Up
Powered by

At the time of writing, How Difficult Is It users rate God Hand as the second most difficult game of all time at 9.1 out of a possible 10. This rating gives it a score of Hardcore! on the site, though it has a low number of only 17 ratings that have pushed it to that status. GameFAQs users, meanwhile, have given it a relatively low score of 4.12 out of 5, which slightly reduces its placement on this list. Nonetheless, both of these ratings are higher than Elden Ring’s , and this Capcom-published brawler earns its place with some devious mechanics. Developed by Clover Studio, the creative minds behind Viewtiful Joe , God Hand combines intense action and a unique sense of humor in a similar fashion.

The story tells of the titular God Hand weapons and an otherworldly race’s attempts to retrieve them from our protagonist and their allies, as they could also be the key to freeing the imprisoned Angara, a demonic deity. Aside from its inimitable sense of humor, the game is best known for its hugely varied combat, which allows players to combine dozens of different moves and techniques into combos of their own design. From conventional uppercuts and jabs to ultimate techniques like Invincible Fist, there are all kinds of tricks up Gene’s sleeve. He’ll need them, too, because button-mashing won’t get players anywhere in God Hand . Swift reactions are key. The difficulty level adapts to the player’s performance, meaning the better they are, the more unpredictable and powerful their enemies will be. This is another Capcom classic that's well worthy of a remake.

Hollow Knight: Silksong

How Difficult Is It: 9.0/10, GameFAQs Difficulty Rating: 4.24/5

Hollow Knight: Silksong
Released
September 4, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Everyone 10+ / Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood
Developer(s)
Team Cherry
Genre(s)
Metroidvania, Action, Adventure, Soulslike
Powered by

There were definitely many players who, while caught up in the Hollow Knight: Silksong hype prior to its September 2025 launch, bought the game without really knowing what they were getting themselves into. It’s a fantastic-looking, sublimely animated Metroidvania, and it turned the heads of many. No one needs to have been a Hollow Knight devotee to have been excited by Silksong , but it probably helped many persevere and not drop the game like a hot potato.

Pharloom is a grim, unforgiving land, and many areas are the sort of places where Elden Ring’s Tarnished would be seen doing countless runs back to a boss gate. It’s not just about the bosses, though, infamous as some of them are. Hornet is far more agile than the previous protagonist, The Knight, but this allowed Team Cherry to go all out on fiendish pogo-based platforming challenges. Our heroine’s moveset is much broader, too, with all-new traps, tools, and skills to employ, but the mastery of all of her talents that’s required to succeed will dissuade lots of players from battling on.

Ghosts 'N Goblins

How Difficult Is It: 8.9/10, GameFAQs Difficulty Rating: 4.72/5

Ghosts 'n Goblins
Shooter
Platformer
Systems
Released
July 7, 1985

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Developer(s)
Capcom
Genre(s)
Shooter, Platformer
Powered by

GameFAQs users awarded Ghost ‘n Goblins the highest average difficulty rating on this list (although just barely), and anyone who’s pitted themselves against this infamous platformer would probably fully support that collective decision. In this Capcom platformer from 1985, the player steps into the (sometimes) armored shoes of Sir Arthur the knight. As would be expected of his heroic creed, Arthur is on a quest to rescue a princess from the clutches of a demon.

It’s a classic platformer with scrolling ladder-climbing and precision jumps, which will also see players constantly throwing their projectiles to keep foes at bay. Famously, there’s very little room to make any mistake here, as taking a hit removes Arthur’s armor and leaves him very vulnerable. In order to succeed, players have to steadily learn level layouts, enemy spawns, and attack patterns. In those terms, Ghosts ‘n Goblins is akin to a Mega Man title, though with a fantastical and macabre twist.

Battletoads

How Difficult Is It: 9.0/10, GameFAQs Difficulty Rating: 4.68/5

Battletoads (1991)
Beat 'Em Up
Platformer
Systems
Released
June 1, 1991

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Developer(s)
Rare, Arc System Works, Mindscape
Genre(s)
Beat 'Em Up, Platformer
Powered by

There aren’t many games that have attained the sheer notoriety of Battletoads . First launching on the NES in 1991, it’s a title that lots of gamers of the time will remember playing, though battling all the way to the end was (and remains) a different prospect entirely. It is, of course, a product of a time when platformers were supposed to be utterly brutal (we’ve already mentioned the Mega Man titles), and with its vehicle levels and other variations on the standard formula, this was certainly one of the hardest of the bunch.

At the time of writing, Battletoads ranks as the third-most difficult game on How Difficult Is It. Beneath its fun cartoon exterior is a devious concoction of every challenge the platformers of the era could throw at players: tricky icy terrain (the Arctic Caverns level isn’t for the faint-hearted), enemies that can take considerable punishment, tight routes through spiky hazards, and countless other horrors await.

item.title: Haven's Hollow Waterfall Cave Treasure Map Easter Egg Guide in COD Warzone
item.description:
Haven's Hollow arrives with Warzone and Black Ops 7's Season 1, placing players into a fresh battleground for Resurgence. Featuring familiar locations like The Mansion from Black Ops 6's Shattered Veil, along with entirely new areas, the map is a strong addition to Warzone's lineup.

While Haven's Hollow delivers fast-paced and competitive action, players who are hunting for exclusive rewards will also find plenty of hidden secrets to uncover. One of these involves a hidden cave that contains a treasure map. For those who have discovered it, here is how to complete the Haven's Hollow Waterfall Cave Treasure Easter Egg.

Step #1: Parachute into the Waterfall Cave & Read the Treasure Map

The first step to completing the Waterfall Cave Easter Egg is to head into the Waterfall Cave on the far north side of Haven’s Hollow. This can only be done by either parachuting in through the opening in the middle of the waterfall when you spawn, or by dropping through the lower opening and then taking the ascender upward.

While you’ll find several Legendary weapons and Supply Crates inside, your main focus should be the treasure map located toward the back of the cave. Reading this map will give you an image showing one of ten possible locations on Haven’s Hollow , along with an X marking the spot of buried treasure. Take note of the image you receive, and then move on to the second step.

Step #2: Use the Map to Find & Dig Up the Treasure

For the next step, you will need to head to the location depicted in the treasure map you viewed earlier. As mentioned before, the image you receive can be one of ten possible images, meaning there are ten possible locations you may need to travel to. We have provided a map above showcasing each of the locations that the possible images refer to. These are all as follows:

  1. By the target range, far northeast of the Mansion
  2. Next to the wooden shack northeast of Homestead
  3. Under the bridge at the Pond
  4. In the garden of the building west of Homestead
  5. Beside the waterwheel warehouse along the river southeast of Homestead
  6. Near the train cart by the river west of the Coal Depot
  7. Along the coast on the far south side of the Train Station
  8. Behind the Riverboat on the southern edge of the map
  9. The bridge southeast of Coal Depot
  10. On the southern side of the Lumbermill

In our case, the treasure map showcased the back of the Riverboat, with the X over on the patch of land on the right side. Therefore, our location was the Riverboat on the south side of the map. In the location specified on the map, you should find a small statue along with a prompt to dig up the hidden buried treasure. Upon doing so, you will receive $20,000, The Plan Calling Card, and 20,000 XP.

Call of Duty: Warzone
9 /10
Released
March 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Drugs, Violence
Developer(s)
Infinity Ward, Raven Software
Franchise
Call of Duty
Genre(s)
First-Person Shooter, Battle Royale
Platform(s)
Xbox One, PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

item.title: Fortnite: How to Unlock All Cat Holloway Cosmetics
item.description:
A new chapter always means that major changes are being made to Fortnite , and the start of Chapter 7 was no different. When Chapter 7 Season 1 launched, players immediately noticed that the layout of the Battle Pass was differented.

This time around, they have to select the page that they want to work towards unlocking. Then, once they have unlocked every rewards in the two rewards pages, they may have to complete quests to gain access to bonus cosmetics. That is the case of the Dark Voyager, Carter Wu, and Cat Holloway cosmetic sets in Fortnite . This guide focuses on the latter and shows playuers how to unlock them all.

Cat Holloway Battle Pass Rewards

How to Unlock Cat Holloway Quests in Fortnite

Once players reach level 5 of the Battle Pass, they will be able to unlock the Cat Holloway tab, which includes two pages filled with themed items. Players have to claim all of the cosmetic items available on these two pages to gain access to her Blitz Royale Quests, which will give them access to her bonus cosmetics .

There are 12 rewards in the Cat Holloway, which means players will need to reach Level 13 in Fortnite to obtain all her standard Battle Pass cosmetic items., which are:

  • Forté Award pickaxe
  • Sponsored By Wonkee Entertainment loading screen
  • The Holloway wrap
  • Ribbons contrail
  • Cat Holloway skin
  • Red Carpet emote
  • Silver Screen Gala glider
  • Silver Screen style for the Forté Award pickaxe
  • Ice Cold Holloway spray
  • Silver Screen Pops back bling
  • Silver Screen Cat style for the Cat Holloway skin

All Cat Holloway Blitz Quests in Fortnite

How to Get Cat Holloway Blitz Royale Rewards in Fortnite

Here are the quests that players will receive once they claim the two Cat Holloway pages in Fortnite :

Socialite Quests

  • Emote at named locations in different matches (3)
  • Collect Exotic or Mythic weapons from eliminated players (3)
  • Enter a Rift within 10 seconds of hitting a player

A-Lister Quests

  • Have items of 4 different rarities in your inventory
  • Damage players with Mythic or Exotic items within 15 meters (1,500)
  • Heatshot players from above with Epic or better weapons (10)

Final Quest

  • Earn a Victory Royale (1)

The Cat Holloway Quests can only be completed in the Blitz Royale game mode. Once players have completed the Socialite Quests, they will unlock the A-Lister Quests. As they progress, they will receive her bonus cosmetics.

After they have finished the two sets of quests, they must earn a Victory Royale in Blitz to obtain her final styles and additional styles for her other cosmetics. Here is what they will receive as a reward:

  • Blitz Gala style for the Silver Screen Gala glider
  • Blitz Pops style for the Silver Screen Pops back bling
  • Blitz Forté Award style for the Forté Award pickaxe
  • Media Blitz Cat style for the Cat Holloway skin (black and grey)

Fortnite

item.title: Diablo 4 Season 11: Who is Azmodan?
item.description:
Season 11 of Diablo 4 is right around the corner, launching on December 11, 2025. Called the Season of Divine Intervention, Season 11 will introduce major new threats, changes to mechanics like Masterworking, the Tower, the Divine Gifts seasonal mechanic, and more, further shaking up Diablo 4 's ARPG sandbox.

One of the most significant additions to Diablo 4 in Season 11 is actually more of a reprisal: Azmodan, one of the seven Lesser Evils and an antagonist of Diablo 3 , will be joining the fray. Known as the Lord of Sin, Azmodan is a grotesque, spider-like demon who played a major role in the Sin War and other conflicts within Hell. He also launched a catastrophic invasion of Sanctuary, and appears to be doing so again with his demonic kinsmen in Diablo 4 Season 11.

Azmodan's Lore and Role in Diablo 4 Season 11, Explained

Azmodan's Early History and Struggle Against the Prime Evils

When Tathamet, the second being to ever exist, was killed by the first being to ever exist, Anu, each of his seven heads festered and morphed into unholy deities known as the Lesser Evils. They are "lesser" only in the sense that they are individually weaker than the three Prime Evils; they are still immeasurably powerful by mortal standards.

Following the Prime Evils' attempts to gain the allegiance of humankind during the Sin Wars, the Lesser Evils grew dismayed and disillusioned, fearing that the Primes were being distracted and cowardly in their war against Heaven. Azmodan worked with Diablo 's Belial, another of the Lesser Evils, to overthrow the Prime Evils and banish them to Sanctuary, the mortal plane of the in-game universe. The pair's main goals were twofold: to gain greater control of Hell for themselves and start a proxy conflict between the Primes and the forces of Heaven in Sanctuary, thus leaving the Gates of Heaven open for attack.

Azmodan and Belial were successful, but would soon turn on each other, thrusting Hell into yet another civil war. Azmodan would hold a significant advantage over his opponent for a long time, but they eventually landed on some semblance of peace, setting their sights on mortalkind once again. Hungry for greater power, and not just over Hell, Azmodan mounted an invasion of Sanctuary.

Azmodan's Role in Diablo 3

Banished to Sanctuary and unable to manifest corporeally without a human host, Diablo, in the spirit of the Dark Wanderer, spawned Leah with the human Adria as an ideal vessel for the Prime Evils. Leah was raised by Deckard Cain and grew up to assist the Nephalem in his battle against Azmodan, who was attempting to steal the Black Soulstone, an apparatus used to entrap demons. This journey would culminate in Diablo 3 's Mount Arreat, where the Nephalem, Adira, Leah, and the fallen angel Tyrael would confront and defeat Azmodan, trapping his spirit in the Black Soulstone along with the other six Lesser Evils.

But Adria, who had been a double-agent for Diablo throughout the entirety of Diablo 3 's story, betrayed the group and sacrificed Leah in order to summon Diablo, who was now infused with the essences of Azmodan and his kin. Despite becoming the most powerful being in existence, Diablo was defeated by the Nephalem, and his spirit returned to the Black Soulstone, still infused with the souls of the Lesser Evils. Eventually, the Black Soulstone was destroyed, and the Lesser Evils broke off from Diablo.

Azmodan's Role in Diablo 4 Season 11

The Lesser evils are returning to Sanctuary in Diablo 4 's 11th season, launching an assault helmed by Azmodan. As such, Azmodan will appear as the first new world boss since Diablo 4 's launch. Players can take him on in both Seasonal and Eternal realms, where he may appear in the following locations:

  • Fractured Peaks - The Crucible
  • Scosglen - Caer Adar
  • Dry Steppes - Saraan Caldera
  • Hawezar - Fields of Desecration
  • Kehjistan - Seared Basin
  • Nahantu - The Cauldron

Azmodan will also be summonable from Summoning Altars in Hawezar, if the player has the requisite Materials. During each battle, Azmodan will appear with a different power related to one of the other six Lesser Evils.

9 /10

Diablo 4

Follow
Followed
Action RPG
Hack and Slash
Systems
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 88 /100 Critics Rec: 93%
Released
June 5, 2023
ESRB
Mature 17+ / Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language, In-Game Purchases, Users Interact
Developer(s)
Blizzard
Publisher(s)
Blizzard
5 Images

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Diablo® IV is the ultimate action-RPG experience with endless evil to slaughter, countless abilities to master, nightmarish dungeons, and legendary loot.

Embark on the epic campaign solo or with friends, meeting memorable characters through a gripping story in a beautifully dark world, or explore an expansive end game: battle iconic bosses for powerful loot, fight back the encroaching onslaught of Hell in Helltides, master the Forge to create your ultimate weapons and progress powerful characters, with cross-play and cross-progression on all available platforms.

Welcome to Hell

Discover the critically acclaimed franchise that defined the Action RPG genre. As the battle between the High Heavens and Burning Hells rages on, hatred devours Sanctuary as evil spreads and a new wave of cultists and worshippers arise to embrace Lilith’s coming. Only a brave few dare to face this threat and bring light to the all-consuming darkness.

Expansive Open World

Forge your own path through the corrupted lands of Sanctuary, an ever-growing, fully explorable world teeming with challenges, quests, enemies, and loot. Join your fellow adventurers, rescue and retake besieged towns, delve into nightmarish dungeons and uncover lost secrets as you fight back evil. The many zones of Sanctuary are yours to explore, and with rotating areas of extreme peril like World Bosses and Helltide, danger lurks at every turn.

Immersive Character Development

Create and customize your character to face the encroaching darkness. Choose from one of five classes and build your hero with skills, abilities and cosmetics, creating a champion that is uniquely your own. Grow stronger as you progress through powerful Skill Trees and develop even more unique end game specializations with Paragon Boards.

Legendary Gear, Epic Battles

Discover and experiment with a vast arsenal of powerful weapons, armor and more to fight back against the demons threatening Sanctuary. Explore unique combinations, create your own upgrades and collect a plethora of powerful tools to battle in immersive, action-packed combat against the deadliest of enemies.

Seasons & Events

The tales of Sanctuary continue to unfold. Create Seasonal Characters and join in fresh adventures - master new mechanics and take on the latest threats in each new Season. Complete harrowing feats of the Season Journey and earn new Battle Pass rewards. Plus, sharpen your swords and get in the spirit of the seasons when Limited-Time Events sweep through Sanctuary.

End Game Undertakings

There’s even more Diablo® IV to explore as you reach higher levels and more fearsome World Tiers. Face the greatest challenge yet as you take on the most powerful demons in The Pit, steel yourself against Uber Bosses to reap uber unique rewards, fight back overflowing armies of Hell as Helltides emerge across Sanctuary, battle larger-than-life World Bosses, and master the Forge to create the mightiest weapons fit for a hero.

Prequel(s)
Diablo 3
Franchise
Diablo
Genre(s)
Action RPG, Hack and Slash
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

item.title: ARC Raiders: 10 Loot Spots So Good Players Refuse To Share Them Publicly
item.description:
The maps in ARC Raiders are full to the brim with loot for players to find. It is hard to go far without finding a decent gun, upgrade materials, or even some nice legendary attachments. However, because of how the areas are laid out, some of the best loot is often located in hotspots full of players and is almost always contested.

While a lot of the more obscure loot locations have already been discovered by the majority of the player base, there are still a few overlooked spots that can house just as many valuable items as even the high-loot zones. A lot of these locations aren't super flashy, but they can gear up a player super quickly without too much hassle or with very few confrontations.

It is difficult to measure how unknown a spot is, so there is a chance you will be familiar with some of these already. Nevertheless, these loot spots are relatively obscure, so hopefully, the article reveals a few areas that are new to you.

Dam Battlegrounds — Radio Tower

Right On The Outskirts

Details:

  • Right on top of a spawn point
  • Spawn chance for every kind of crate, including weapons

Dam Battlegrounds is the very first map that any new player will load into, and because of that, the entire area has been scoured from top to bottom for the best loot spots. A lot of people instinctively run to the big highlighted areas like the Control Tower, but there are actually some great spots to check on the farthest reaches of the map.

Towards the West of the Scrap Yard, there is a radio tower standing in the open that has a chance to contain everything from a weapons case to up to three ammo crates. It's a prime location to check for anyone spawning on the South side of the map, and because of where it is, the loot is virtually free to anyone who decides to check it out.

Buried City — Marano Station

Weapons And Ammo Galore

Details:

  • Rarely checked, especially early into a match
  • Two weapon spawns within 50m

Marano Station is a marked location in Buried City that seems like just another piece of architecture for players to enjoy in the background. In reality, it is a pretty great loot spot that can give ARC Raiders players some decent loot before they head further into the map.

On the north side of the station, there is a breachable door with a small room that can spawn a weapon and utility crate, as well as having some higher-value breach containers for players to open up while they are around. Also, if players climb up to the roof, there is another weapon crate spawn, and a third slightly to the East, turning this basic area into an incredibly valuable loot zone.

Spaceport — Fuel Lines

Hidden In Plain Sight

Details:

  • Upturned pipe with weapons case spawn
  • Simple but very easy to run past

Spaceport has an incredible open layout that allows players to see virtually anywhere on the map from a single raised location. However, despite having some pretty abundant areas in the towers and buildings, there are a few sneaky spots that players should always check during their runs.

Right below the Fuel Lines map indicator is a vertical pipe that can spawn a weapon crate that so many players just simply don't know about. What makes the spot so great despite only offering up a single crate is because of its location, being on the way to other large loot zones and near player spawns, that checking it takes virtually no time, despite the payoff potentially being pretty big.

Blue Gate — Highway Collapse

More Than Just A Quest Location

Details:

  • Multiple spawns are all very close by
  • Fast access to a bag, medical supplies, and a weapon case

The Highway Collapse is a spot that many players will be familiar with on Blue Gate. The 'Reduced to Rubble' quest takes them directly to it, and there are three spawns that put players within touching distance, but many just leave the zone without double-checking the surrounding area.

To the East, there is a bus that has a weapon crate spawn, as well as a medical spawn directly underneath the same piece of road. Back the other way, players can grab a bag from the underside, a utility crate from within the Western segment, and even two ammo ones right at the end, gifting players all the resources they could ever need right at the start.

Stella Montis — Assembly line

In The Middle Of The Firefights

Details:

  • Four case spawns within 10m
  • Elevated weapon/medical bag that many ignore

Stella Montis was the first new map added to ARC Raiders since launch, and it gives players a completely different feel from the rest of the locations. Almost entirely inside, it's a PvP warzone where every sound is important, and every loot location is constantly under pressure.

Among all the chaos, players can take a visit to the assembly line and grab a nice hidden weapon or medical bag just outside the main loot area. Located in a hanging metal frame, virtually no one checks it, giving players a free piece of extra gear that will no doubt help them in the upcoming fights.

Spaceport — Staff Parking/Fuel Lines Tower

Above The Bastions And Bombardiers

Details:

  • Towers around the map with weapons cases and high weapon rates in the drawers
  • Security breaches in both towers, alongside other containers

Out of all the maps in the game, Spaceport is easily the most vertically oriented, having a huge tower right in the center like Dam Battlegrounds, but with plenty of other towering structures that are scattered around the area.

These taller buildings can actually be some of the best to check, one because the loot is good, but two, because players are too lazy to go all the way up. Two of these structures are located next to the Fuel Lines and Staff Parking, each housing a potential security breach spawn, alongside weapons, ammo, medical supplies, and any other loot a hungry Raider could need.

Buried City — Piazza Roma

Tucked Behind The Trees

Details:

  • Multiple weapon spawns in the same building
  • Hot zone for so many other weapon cases, all outside high-loot zones

Throughout all the cramped buildings and tight corridors, it can be hard to locate good loot spawns in Buried City. The zones can be a useful guide, but because of how easy it is to hear everything, a single container being opened could be all it takes for another player to rock up and ruin your day.

That's why checking the outer areas is a great way of getting some good loot safely, and the houses in the West Village are easily some of the best for this. Directly below Piazza Roma is a house with two weapon case spawns inside, and to the East, the larger structure has three more, all outside high-loot zones, and all hidden away from those pesky PvPers.

Dam Battleground — Electrical Tower

In And Out In A Flash

Details:

  • Very close to the extraction point
  • Several player spawns and bonus loot to the south

Anyone who has played more than a few matches of Dam Battlegrounds will know about the Testing Annex extraction point. It is one of the most common locations to leave, and is slotted right next to a decent loot zone, near a high one, and within shooting range of a Harvester spawn.

This means that most of the loot will be long gone for players who spawn late into a match; however, just off the mainland lies the Electrical Tower, a sneaky spot that can give you some extra loot before leaving. An ammo crate and some nice containers can be found inside the structure, and a short walk to the south gives players a weapon spawn and some more ammo, letting them loot and zipline back before anyone can take them out.

Spaceport — Arrival Building

No One Checks The Roof

Details:

  • A ladder on the rear side that often goes unchecked
  • Four weapon spawns in the area, with several containers on the roof

High-loot zones are always the most contested out of any location on the maps. That said, for places like the Arrival Building on Spaceport, it can actually be one of the best places to check, even further into a Raid after all the good loot is supposed to be gone.

Inside the building alone, there are three weapon case spawns, alongside some ammo and medical supplies that can all be grabbed within about a minute. Yet the most important place to check is on the root, which can be accessed from the back via a ladder, and up top, there are even more spawn locations that virtually no player checks despite constantly running past them.

Blue Gate — Maintenance Bunker

Waiting Below The Action

Details:

  • Next to a lesser-used extraction zone
  • Security locker alongside other bags that are rarely looted

As many people know, the best loot on Blue Gate is often tucked below the surface, as under the mountains lies a large complex of rooms and corridors full of puzzles, locked doors, and a boatload of loot that is always being chased by players the second they load in.

Keeping that theme of subterranean loot, the Maintenance Bunker is another great spot to check, but it is also one that is basically left untouched right up until the end of the match. The reason the spot is so good is that it is right next to an extraction point, so players can run down, loot the security locker and the rest of the bunker, and get out before the window closes to get out.
